db:abstract.db:para: The QPageSetupDialog class provides a configuration dialog for the page-related options on a printer.

db:listitem.db:para: QPageSetupDialog is part of standard-dialogsPrinter and Printing APIs

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: On Windows and Mac OS X the page setup dialog is implemented using the native page setup dialogs.

Note that on Windows and Mac OS X custom paper sizes won't be reflected in the native page setup dialogs. Additionally, custom page margins set on a QPrinter won't show in the native Mac OS X page setup dialog.

db:section.db:title: [explicit, since 4.5] QPageSetupDialog::QPageSetupDialog(QWidget *parent = 0)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a page setup dialog that configures a default-constructed QPrinter with parent as the parent widget.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.5.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QPageSetupDialog::QPageSetupDialog(QPrinter *printer, QWidget *parent = 0)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a page setup dialog that configures printer with parent as the parent widget.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] int QPageSetupDialog::exec()
db:section.db:para: This virtual function is called to pop up the dialog. It must be reimplemented in subclasses.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.5] void QPageSetupDialog::open(QObject *receiver, const char *member)
db:section.db:para: Opens the dialog and connects its accepted() signal to the slot specified by receiver and member.
The signal will be disconnected from the slot when the dialog is closed.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.5.

db:section.db:title: QPrinter *QPageSetupDialog::printer()
db:section.db:para: Returns the printer that was passed to the QPageSetupDialog constructor.
